textBox.richText: Idiap was granted a new Swiss National Science Foundation project: UniTS (Unified Speech Processing Framework for Trustworthy Speaker Recognition). The overall goal of the research project is to develop novel features and models for trustworthy speaker recognition. Specifically, we will investigate: (1) learning of speaker-related features directly from the raw speech signal using up and coming deep learning techniques and their application to speaker recognition and speaker diarization. (2) development of anti-spoofing techniques, i.e. countermeasures, to protect speaker recognition systems against spoofing attacks. The proposed research is a collaboration between the Speech and Audio Processing group (Dr. Mathew Magimai Doss, main advisor) and the Biometric Person Recognition group (Dr. Sebastien Marcel, co-advisor) at Idiap. The research will also rely on previous knowledge and softwares developed at Idiap, more specifically Bob toolkit (http://idiap.github.io/bob/) and Torch (http://torch.ch).
New research project on trustworthy speaker recognition
